alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Charlotte; Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:40PM EST until January 11 at 7:45AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. Dan River at Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Halifax, Charlotte and Campbell Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including Wentworth, STP near Danville, Dan River at Paces, South Boston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Brookneal. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Low-lying fields and woods are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EST Wednesday was 26.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.2 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.5 feet on 10/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
